At Yelp, it’s our mission to connect people with great local businesses. Yelp’s unique dataset contains billions of interactions between users and local businesses around the globe, from a user reviewing a neighborhood coffee shop to requesting a repair quote with a photo of a leaky faucet. Data Scientists at Yelp work to make sense of these interactions to deliver impactful analyses and products to our users, business partners, and the general public.

The Data Science team performs analyses, builds models, and designs experiments that directly impact Yelp’s business and users. Our centralized team is the most wide-ranging consumer of data at Yelp, adept at tasks from modeling content growth and user behavior to sharing insights about the health of local economies. With varied backgrounds and expertise, we strive for learning and growth in a collaborative environment.

This opportunity has the option to be fully remote throughout Germany.

Job summary *Flexibility for alternate EU Amazon offices* Amazon’s mission is to be the most customer centric company in the world. The Workforce Staffing organization is on the front line of that mission by hiring the hourly fulfilment associates who make that mission a reality. To drive the necessary growth and continued scale of Amazon’s associate needs within a constrained employment environment, Amazon is creating a Workforce Staffing Analytics program. This program will re-invent how Amazon attracts, communicates with, and ultimately hires its hourly associates. This team will own multi-layered research and program implementation to drive deep learnings, process improvements, and strategic recommendations to global leadership. Are you passionate about data? Are you a tinkerer by trade? Do you enjoy questioning the status quo? Do complex and difficult challenges excite you? If yes, this may be the team for you. As a Data Scientist in Workforce Staffing, your work is focused on research programs to deeply understand the people that make up our hourly workforce. You understand that even when hiring hundreds of thousands of hourly associates across multiple types of roles and businesses, the experience of each candidate matters. You use your deep expertise in statistics (regressions, multilevel models, structural equation models, etc.), and data collection in a variety of settings (e.g., field studies, surveys, existing large data sets) to define and answer nebulous problems. You leverage your quantitative background to develop and test theoretical frameworks and design experiments. You design, deployment, and conduct analysis of our global candidate research activities, using experimental, quasi-experimental, and RCT methods. You relentlessly obsess over understanding our candidates and what attracts them to Amazon. You work with colleagues across Research, Data Science, Business Intelligence and related teams to enable Amazon find and hire the right candidates for the right roles at an unprecedented scale. This will be a highly visible role across multiple key deliverables for our global organization. If you are passionate and curious about data, obsess over customers, love questioning the status quo, and want to make the world a better place, let’s chat.

Wir sind eine People Company,
denn die Zufriedenheit unserer Mitarbeiter liegt uns sehr am Herzen. In unserem Team ist jedes einzelne Mitglied in der Lage, das eigene Potenzial voll zu entfalten. Wir sind füreinander da, respektieren uns gegenseitig und finden für alles eine gemeinsame Lösung. Mit Menschlichkeit, moderner Technologie und Methodik halten wir unsere Fachlichkeit hoch und schaffen somit einen Mehrwert für unsere Kunden und unsere Community.

Als Softwareunternehmen wollen wir nicht nur unsere Technologie an unsere Kunden bringen, sondern sie darüber hinaus auch befähigen, Mehrwert in ihrem Unternehmen zu schaffen. Der ständige Austausch mit unseren Kunden steht daher klar im Fokus, um uns, unsere Software und die darauf basierenden Lösungen stetig weiterzuentwickeln und zu verbessern. Wir möchten die Welt der Compliance & Audit verändern, in dem wir sie mit unseren Produkten und digitalen Lösungen vereinfachen.

About ICIS
ICIS is part of Risk Solutions Group (RSG) a division of RELX Group, a FTSE 20 company with revenues of $9.5 billion in 2020. ICIS make some of the world’s most important markets more trusted and predictable by providing data services, thought leadership and decision tools. We exist to help businesses in the energy, petrochemical and fertilizer industries make strategic decisions, mitigate risk, improve productivity, and capitalise on new opportunities. Thousands of decisions are taken across supply chains every day using our intelligence and we make this possible through a global presence that delivers the targeted, local insights customers need to achieve growth in this new world of meaningful data. Shaping the world by connecting markets to optimise the worlds valuable resources. With a global team of more than 700, ICIS has employees based in London, New York, Houston, Karlsruhe, Milan, Mumbai, Singapore, Guangzhou, Beijing, Shanghai, Dubai, Sao Paulo, Seoul, Tokyo and Perth.
Job Purpose
You will drive data-based innovation by developing analytical models, visualisations, and tools to analyse and forecast one of the largest industries in the world - the chemical industry - a complex global supply network. As a Data Scientist, you will join our experienced team of Data Scientists and work closely together with our large team of market analysts around the globe. Our models cover prices, supply / demand, costs and logistics to drive trading and production decisions across the industry. You will be part of an international team, which requires occasional travel globally. As of day one, you will have responsibility in demanding analytics innovation projects - your first focus will be to support the development of our analytics platform, providing analysts and clients with market analytics and visualisations tools to better understand and forecast the complex chemical value chain, from oil to refined products. Our Senior Data Scientists will help you grow into taking ownership of analytics around parts of the markets for which you will be able to drive innovation.

Wer wir sind?
Wir sind o2/Telefónica – mit unseren Mobilfunkmarken verbinden wir Millionen von Menschen und bieten unseren Kund:innen mobile Freiheit in der digitalen Welt. Darüber hinaus gestalten wir als führender Telekommunikationsanbieter maßgeblich die Digitalisierung in Deutschland mit. Unsere Fest- und Mobilfunknetze bilden das Rückgrat für den digitalen Wandel von Wirtschaft und Gesellschaft. Und unsere rund 8.000 Mitarbeiter:innen hierzulande treiben die Transformation jeden Tag ein Stück voran – auch in unserem eigenen Unternehmen.

DIE ZUKUNFT DER MOBILITÄT? DIGITAL.
TEILE DEINE LEIDENSCHAFT.
Mehr als 90 % aller Innovationen im Automobil basieren auf Elektronik und Software. Gerade hier sind große Freiräume und vernetztes Denken gefordert, um die Mobilität neu zu erfinden und ein völlig neues Fahrerlebnis zu ermöglichen. Deshalb geben wir Studierenden bei uns nicht nur die Gelegenheit zum Zuhören, sondern auch zum Mitreden und Weiterdenken.
Wir, die BMW Group, bieten dir ein spannendes und abwechslungsreiches Praktikum im Bereich Versorgungssicherung und Digitalisierung.

Um unsere Aufgaben auf die nächste Stufe zu setzen, bietet die Abteilung der Liefersicherheit ein Praktikumsplatz an, welcher einen Beitrag zum Think Tank der BMW Group leistet und die Führungsrolle von BMW im Bereich des Lieferkettenmanagements fortsetzt. Das Ziel des Think Tank ist die Erforschung neuer Technologien, einschließlich Data Science (ML, AI, BI etc.). Als Praktikant bist du Teil der BMW-Zuliefererkettendigitalisierung im Arbeitskreis, einem globalen Netzwerk von Zulieferketten- und Data-Science-Experten, die digitale Lösungen bei der BMW Group einsetzen und austauschen.

bewirb dich bei fida als:
data scientist (m/w/d)
was macht ein data scientist (m/w/d)?*
*
Als Data Scientist (m/w/d) machst Du Deine Leidenschaft zum Beruf. Erstelle komplexe Datenanalysen und entwickle prognostische Modelle auf Basis moderner statistischer Methoden zur Betrugserkennung. Darüber hinaus konzipierst und leitest Du Trainings und Schulungen im Bereich Data Analytics / Data Architecture.
Was bringst Du mit?
**
Abgeschlossenes Studium in (Wirtschafts-) Informatik oder –Mathematik, Statistik, Physik, Volks- oder Betriebswirtschaft

GameDuell is one of the leading casual gaming companies in Germany, based in the heart of Berlin. With over 130 million registered players worldwide and a broad portfolio of over 40 casual online skill games, we are constantly looking for ways to improve our product.
To fulfill our mission of bringing people together to have fun with games, we are looking for a (Senior) Data Scientist to further develop our data platform, which serves as the foundation for analytics, to drive decision-making across the business.
The position is equally suitable for both part-time (30 hrs./week or more) or full-time (40 hrs./week) work.
Your tasks
Analysis of user behavior based on tracking data incl. data cleaning, data analytics, data clustering, churn analysis, and data visualization

As our Lead Data Scientist you are responsible for all matters related to data. As we grow our company your responsibilities will grow with it. You will start by leading our effort to further develop our instant pricing algorithm and enhance it with further offerings as our platform grows. As we gather more operational data you will work with the engineering team to develop insights, for example to develop a predictive analytics model. As an integral part of our growth team, you will have the opportunity to build your own team over time with the skills required to achieve our ambitious goals.
Responsibilities:

Own and improve a Python model optimizing the instant pricing algorithm of our platform. Identify and implement new algorithms to optimize the current pricing strategy and roadmap
Engineer features to improve our matchmaking algorithm and supplier allocation
Work with the business development and sales team to improve models for pricing, lead times, customer behaviour

Lidl Stiftung & Co. KG Neckarsulm
Stiftsbergstraße 1
74167 Neckarsulm

Mehr als 11.200 Filialen und 200 Logistikzentren in 32 Ländern – das ist Lidl. Um unsere anspruchsvollen Ziele weiterhin effizient erreichen zu können, suchen wir dich als Verstärkung für unseren Analytics-Bereich. Hier begleiten wir Lidl auf dem Weg zu einem datengetriebenen Unternehmen und pilotieren im „Fail-Fast Ansatz“ innovative Business-Anwendungen im Schulterschluss mit den Fachabteilungen (Vertrieb, Einkauf etc.). Dazu beraten wir diese bei Fragestellungen und gestalten weltweite Geschäftsprozesse mit. Zusätzlich unterstützen wir die Länder, dezentral Analytics-Kompetenzen aufzubauen und durch eine enge Zusammenarbeit die internationalen Synergien zu schöpfen. Bewirke Großes und erlebe, dass sich dein Einstieg lohnt – am internationalen Hauptsitz von Lidl in Neckarsulm.

The Borstel Research Center is an internationally renowned research institute, financed by the Federal Government and the State of Schleswig-Holstein. Our central task is research and patient care in the field of respiratory diseases. We operate both basic research infrastructures and a medical clinic. Computer Scientist (m/f/d)

Du arbeitest auf komplexen Sequenz-Daten, eine der anspruchsvollsten Datenstrukturen.

Alpha Neun: Care, Craft, Excite - ein buntes Team qualifizierter, ambitionierter und offener Menschen, dass sich gerade neu erfindet. Unsere Mission: kleine und mittelständische Unternehmen mit den Menschen in Ihrer Umgebung zusammenzubringen und einen vertrauensvollen und erfolgreichen Umgang miteinander zu ermöglichen. Wir gestalten die Zukunft als Teil des digitalen Wandels in allen Branchen. Unsere Basis ist sicher, das Potenzial riesig und der Raum zur Entwicklung nahezu grenzenlos.
Wir leben modernes, integriertes und flexibles Arbeiten –pragmatisch und professionell. Wir gestalten, prototypen, testen und implementieren, denken Designsystemisch und leben digitale Markenführung weit über den Pixel hinaus. Im Zentrum steht das Team, unsere Messlatte ist unser eigener Anspruch.
Alpha Neun entwickelt seit über 10 Jahren innovative Lösung im Bereich Crawling & Datenanalyse und Services. Mit einem Team von 15 Mitarbeitern betreiben wir unter Anderem die lokale Suchmaschine "auskunft.de", die wir im Laufe des kommenden Jahres vollständig überholen. Wir befinden uns in einer spannenden Zeit des Umbruchs und suchen motivierte, freundliche und kompetente Kolleg*innen, die sich gerne einbringen und Spaß daran haben, ihren Job mitzugestalten.

Schleswig-Holstein Netz AG | Quickborn | Unbefristet | Teil- oder Vollzeit

Die Schleswig-Holstein Netz AG leitet als Netzbetreiber Strom und Gas zu 2,8 Millionen Menschen in Schleswig-Holstein. Zusätzlich bieten wir technische Dienstleistungen im Bereich Strom und Gas an, zum Beispiel den Bau und Betrieb von Umspannwerken oder Trafostationen mit passenden Services, kommunale Straßenbeleuchtung sowie Wallboxen für klimafreundliche E-Autos. Unser Team besteht aus über 1.400 Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeitern an vielen Standorten in ganz Schleswig-Holstein und in unserer Zentrale in Quickborn. Wir sind einer der größten Ausbildungsbetriebe im Norden und unterstützen landesweit viele soziale Projekte. Als Partner der Energiewende haben wir bereits zehntausende Windräder und Solaranlagen an unser Stromnetz angeschlossen. Wir engagieren uns in Innovationsprojekten für mehr Klimaschutz und werden selbst bereits 2030 klimaneutral sein.

Zur Verstärkung unseres Teams der Schleswig-Holstein Netz AG suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt für unseren Standort Quickborn eine/n Data-Scientist (m/w/d)*. Bei Interesse bewerbe dich bitte bis zum 16.10.2022.

Looking for new opportunities in one of Germany's top environmental tech startups? Air pollution is one of the biggest challenges of our times. This is why Hawa Dawa ("Air Medicine") was founded in 2016, with the vision to digitise and revolutionise the air quality management market.

We are an interdisciplinary and growing team of professionals combining expert knowledge in air quality measurement, epidemiology, data science, clean mobility, business, software and IOT hardware. The foundation of our work is the data we generate for our customers: we pride ourselves in producing reliable and solid products that are relevant for air quality measurement, smart city products, new mobility services and more.

Behind good products are great people - and we currently require additional (wo)man power to continue developing our internal sensor calibration and management software. For this position, we are looking for someone with a number of years experience developing and applying machine learning algorithms for in-production systems. You will work primarily with Python code and SQL (relational) databases. Substantively, you will work at our core and unique technical proposition - where we use software and ML to process the raw measurements of our sensors and leverage their output to a quality level, which so far only much more expensive hardware was able to reach. Focusing on writing good code will be one of your key tasks. Occasionally, you will be asked to present and explain technical concepts to others in the company as well as external stakeholders. You will be a valued member of our software team from day one, planning and implementing tasks together using an agile methodology. Your efforts will be key to ensuring our air pollution sensor network creates high quality output and functions at a global scale.

Our headquarters are located in the heart of Munich, within walking distance to the Theresienwiese and very accessible with public transportation or bike.

Hawa Dawa is a young clean-tech company with a big dream. You’ll be a part of a team founded on open-mindedness, enthusiasm and impact on the environmental health. You can find out more about us on our careers page.

Your efforts will be key to ensuring our air pollution sensor network creates high quality output and functions at a global scale.

Our headquarters are located in the heart of Munich, within walking distance to the Theresienwiese and very accessible with public transportation or bike.

Hawa Dawa is a young clean-tech company with a big dream. You’ll be a part of a team founded on open-mindedness, enthusiasm and impact on the environmental health. You can find out more about us on our careers page.

CarboCode is an international biotechnology company founded in 2017. Our dynamic team and business are rapidly expanding, currently we employ more than 60 highly skilled professionals with 20 different nationalities. CarboCode is a company that aspiring to improve human health and wellbeing by making human natural lipid and oligosaccharide molecules widely available. CarboCode core capabilities spans a variety of technologies spanning through advanced biotechnological production, chemical synthesis, and to biocatalysis. About ICIS
ICIS is part of Risk Solutions Group (RSG) a division of RELX Group, a FTSE 20 company with revenues of $9.5 billion in 2020. ICIS make some of the world’s most important markets more trusted and predictable by providing data services, thought leadership and decision tools. We exist to help businesses in the energy, petrochemical and fertilizer industries make strategic decisions, mitigate risk, improve productivity, and capitalise on new opportunities. Thousands of decisions are taken across supply chains every day using our intelligence and we make this possible through a global presence that delivers the targeted, local insights customers need to achieve growth in this new world of meaningful data. Shaping the world by connecting markets to optimise the worlds valuable resources. With a global team of more than 700, ICIS has employees based in London, New York, Houston, Karlsruhe, Milan, Mumbai, Singapore, Guangzhou, Beijing, Shanghai, Dubai, Sao Paulo, Seoul, Tokyo and Perth.

As a Senior Data Scientist you will enable our global Fleet team to boost our decision-making capabilities with powerful optimisation models that will impact every aspect of our business. Job Title: Junior Scientist (f/m/d) – Cell culture, viral vectors and cell/virus-based ATMPS
Job Description:
Coriolis Pharma , is a globally operating service provider and one of the world leaders in formulation research and development of (bio)pharmaceutical drugs and vaccines.
We revolutionize the development process of biopharmaceutical drugs by integrating innovative digital formulation approaches from drug development to commercial products.
As a people and team-oriented company with an interdisciplinary team of highly skilled scientists and an expert scientific advisory board, we provide cutting-edge services and tailor-made solutions for our clients.
Our company culture is based on diversity, teamwork and open and appreciative communication. That's why wonderful people from over 25 nations around the world work together successfully at Coriolis.

Sanos Group is a digital health company with the vision to save and transform the lives of millions of smokers through technology. We develop a digital behaviour change platform to enable smokers to take control of their lives, to quit, avoid relapse and develop healthy lifestyle habits. We use mobile technology, machine learning and wearable technology to further develop the best evidence based quit and relapse prevention strategies. A connected device that automatically adjusts nicotine intake and a companion app with a personalized therapy program based on machine learning.

Aufgaben

As a member of our agile, cross-functional team, you will help to design and develop interpretable machine learning models running on device and on backend and work at every stage of the development lifecycle, from design to data preparation to provisioning and monitoring. You will build pipelines to automate the data preparation process and the training, evaluation and provisioning of the models. You will set up monitoring systems to keep track of the model quality and detect concept drifts. You will work closely with our backend and mobile engineering teams. Above all, you are a team player, have a can-do attitude, and like to come up with new ideas and bring them to a team discussion.

Qualifikation


Benefits

The founding team is located in Berlin but we have a remote-first ethos. However, we require that you get registered in Berlin and eligible to work in the EEA due to our grant support program.

If you would like to work with us, send us your CV and a non-formal intro outlining why you are the kick-ass fullstack data scientist we need to succeed. Feel free to share with us your Github profile, blog or other projects you’ve worked on too.

Let's win together

Tvarit GmbH develops and delivers solutions in the field of artificial intelligence (AI) for the Manufacturing, automotive and process industries. With its software products, Tvarit makes it possible to its customers to make intelligent and well-founded decisions, e.g., in the forward-looking Maintenance, increasing the OEE and predictive quality. We have renowned reference customers, competent technology, a good research team from renowned Universities and the award of renowned AI prize (e.g., EU Horizon 2020) which makes Tvarit one of the most innovative AI companies in Germany and Europe. We are looking for a self-motivated person with a positive "can-do" attitude and excellent oral and written communication skills in English.

(Senior) Data Scientist-2211158

OUR COMPANY

At Boehringer Ingelheim we develop breakthrough therapies and innovative healthcare solutions in areas of unmet medical need for both humans and animals. As a family owned company, we focus on long-term performance. We believe that, if we have talented and ambitious people who are passionate about innovation, there is no limit to what we can achieve; after all, we started with just 28 people. Now, we are powered by 50,000 employees globally who nurture a diverse, collaborative and inclusive culture.

What we do: SDL Machine Translation and Iconic Translation Machines have come together to provide the world's most powerful, comprehensive and adaptable neural machine translation platform - Language Weaver. We provide secure enterprise machine translation solutions, adapted to our businesses content - empowering our customers to communicate without language barriers.
Language Weaver is an award-winning proprietary technology which grew from research labs across the world, to the workflows of global enterprises. Its core function is to integrate with content intelligence applications to minimize the effort required to translate multilingual content.
Language Weaver is part of RWS, a world-leading provider of technology-enabled language, content management and intellectual property services. We help our clients to connect with and bring new ideas to people globally, by communicating business critical content at scale and enabling the protection and realisation of their innovations.

The Ernst Ruska-Centre for Microscopy and Spectroscopy with Electrons (ER-C) at the Forschungszentrum Jülich houses some of the world`s most advanced electron microscopes and tools for nanocharacterisation. Our scientific research combines current issues in condensed matter physics and cryo-EM on biomacromolecules with the aim of advancing electron microscopy methods. Under one roof, the ER-C has a total of 15 electron microscopes including the PICO FEI Titan with a point resolution of 0.5 Å. The facility has been extended with state-of-the-art cryo-microscopes ThermoFisher Titan Krios, Talos Arctica both equipped with a Bioquantum K3 and Talos 120 as well as FIB-SEM Aquilos 2. At the Ernst Ruska-Centre for Microscopy and Spectroscopy with Electrons - Structural Biology (ER-C-3) we investigate the structural and molecular mechanism of membrane biology processes and push the development of cryo-EM related methodology. Our campus in Jülich hosts a vibrant electron microscopy, biophysics and structural biology community.
Your Job:
Develop new acquisition schemes and workflows based on novel hardware to advance low-dose cryo-EM techniques

We are proud to belong to the TOP 1% of all employers in Germany 2021 & 2022!
Our Story
At Wooga, we are very proud of the diverse, creative and friendly environment we have established and we believe you will enjoy working with some of the best people in the industry. Senior Data Scientist (f/m/d)
About the Role

Essity has a clear strategy to become a data driven organization and is investing in collecting and analyzing data from sales, back office and the factory floor to provide to enable more relevant insights across the organization. Essity has already deployed connected solutions using IoT technologies in Professional Hygiene and Incontinence Care solutions to improve the lives of people using these new technologies. To take this to the next level we need new capabilities to unlock the insights hidden within these data sources.

Therefore, we are searching for an experienced Senior Data Scientist (f/m/d). The purpose of the role is to develop data-driven solutions to difficult business challenges across a range of business domains by using state-of-the-art machine learning techniques and understand how to convert theory and models into company operations. The Senior Data Scientist will as act as a team leader for the data science team (line management responsibility).

The impact you will make
As Experiment Scientist, you are responsible for planning and execution of experimental campaigns and diagnostic development at a world-class, petawatt, short-pulse laser facility.

The Experiment and Laser Groups at Marvel Fusion are implementing a new research laboratory at an ultra-high-intensity, short-pulse laser facility in the Greater Munich area with the goal to demonstrate key features of our unique laser-driven fusion concept. Be part of the team that sets up the new target area from scratch, continues to perform the first measurements using our nanotargets in intense laser fields, creates novel diagnostic instruments with high fidelity, and demonstrates a path to fusion energy generation. You will bring your expertise to the creation of the design, the prototype phase and the activities during the build and verification of the various phases. You will be actively involved in all stages of the process and contribute to the implementation of the project.

Activities will be performed in the Greater Munich area, with occasional travel to research facilities world-wide.

Job Title: Data Scientist focused on Trustworthy AI (m/f/d)*
Job Description: Data Scientist focused on Trustworthy AI (m/f/d)* For the Data & Analytics Division – Artificial Intelligence Location Munich The Artificial Intelligence group in the Data & Analytics Division leverages state-of-the-art machine learning technologies to shape the future of the insurance industry. Data can be internal, external, structured or unstructured. Our missions encompass improving underwriting (risk assessment and pricing), claims management decisions and offering new services and business models through data-driven methods. Our focus areas span a wide range of applications, including automated information extraction, risk model improvements, remote sensing and certification and insurance of algorithms. Our department cooperates closely with Data Engineering, IT, business units, and Global Innovation. We offer you the possibility of applying the latest machine learning and deep learning methods to the insurance space within a highly motivated team of business developers, product managers and data scientists. As the world’s largest reinsurer, we can provide an extremely diverse and exciting set of business opportunities and data sets for you to work on. We offer unparalleled development opportunities in a fast-developing field within a leading quantitative organisation. We are looking for a creative thinker to drive trustworthy AI developments, both internally and externally as part of dedicated business ventures. Your job Actively working on and leading projects that enable business units and ventures to generate more and better business (quantitative and qualitative aspects) using NLP, ML and statistics. Designing and implementing solutions around trustworthy AI, from prototype to production Supporting and advising business units in applying the latest methods and providing a central source for specialised data analysis and modelling know-how, tools and methods Presenting your findings and the systems developed to internal and external stakeholders Identifying and assessing the potential of statistical, ML and NLP innovations and technologies that could offer potential competitive advantages in the insurance space Networking with existing quantitative units in the reporting and analysis fields, and with IT to create an AI community University degree (master’s or above) in a quantitative field (mathematics, computer science, physics, engineering, business analytics) with a solid understanding of probabilities, statistics and machine learning Outstanding theoretical and practical understanding of modern machine learning and artificial intelligence techniques; expertise in at least one of the following areas: natural language processing (NLP), computer vision, knowledge graphs, recommender systems, time series Hands-on experience in trustworthy AI, responsible AI, digital ethics and related regulation (e.g. EU AI Act) as well as compliance rules from a technical perspective; good understanding of related testing methodologies and test tools is a plus Very strong presentation, strategic thinking, consulting and project management skills; demonstrated interest in taking ownership of technical initiatives from coordination to implementation. Excellent Python programming skills and fluency in ML frameworks like Pytorch or, Tensorflow; experience in Java is a plus. Solid knowledge of software development best practices (version control, testing), architecture design, object-oriented programming, data structure and algorithms Readiness to embrace innovation, forward-looking, Group-wide manner of thinking and action, pronounced service focus, ability to work in a team, and a very high level of commitment High level of accountability, capability to deal with uncertainty and execute in an ambiguous environment Very good command of English and a willingness to travel. As the world's leading reinsurance company with more than 11,000 employees at over 50 locations, Munich Re introduces a paradigm shift in the way you think about insurance. By turning uncertainty into a manageable risk we enable fundamental change. Join us working on topics today that will concern society tomorrow, whether that be climate change, major construction projects, medical risk assessment or even space travel. Together we embrace a culture where multiskilled teams dare to think big. We create the new and the different for our clients and cultivate innovation. Sounds like you? Make it happen and be part of Munich Re. You will work in an environment where we think big: Change and culture are continuously role-modeled. We create and articulate a compelling and ambitious shared purpose, vision and direction. We pave the way towards success and see failure as learning You are going to experience that we care & dare: We are empathetic. We know when to lead and know when to let others lead. We attract, grow and coach future leaders We communicate in a clear & authentic way: We interact with a positive and humble spirit. We solicit feedback, ask and listen, learn and unlearn You will grow with your clients: Whatever our role, we support business, in an efficient and effective way, to create value for our clients. We embrace new ways of working leveraging digitalization to deliver solutions Join us, and experience that we lead the We: We have a passion for winning and growing as a team. We inspire people to be capable of joint performance. We create an inclusive environment where different thoughts, generations, cultures and experiences are valued and encouraged Apply now! Designing and implementing solutions around trustworthy AI, from prototype to production Supporting and advising business units in applying the latest methods and providing a central source for specialised data analysis and modelling know-how, tools and methods Presenting your findings and the systems developed to internal and external stakeholders Identifying and assessing the potential of statistical, ML and NLP innovations and technologies that could offer potential competitive advantages in the insurance space Networking with existing quantitative units in the reporting and analysis fields, and with IT to create an AI community University degree (master’s or above) in a quantitative field (mathematics, computer science, physics, engineering, business analytics) with a solid understanding of probabilities, statistics and machine learning Outstanding theoretical and practical understanding of modern machine learning and artificial intelligence techniques; expertise in at least one of the following areas: natural language processing (NLP), computer vision, knowledge graphs, recommender systems, time series Hands-on experience in trustworthy AI, responsible AI, digital ethics and related regulation (e.g. EU AI Act) as well as compliance rules from a technical perspective; good understanding of related testing methodologies and test tools is a plus Very strong presentation, strategic thinking, consulting and project management skills; demonstrated interest in taking ownership of technical initiatives from coordination to implementation. Excellent Python programming skills and fluency in ML frameworks like Pytorch or, Tensorflow; experience in Java is a plus. Solid knowledge of software development best practices (version control, testing), architecture design, object-oriented programming, data structure and algorithms Readiness to embrace innovation, forward-looking, Group-wide manner of thinking and action, pronounced service focus, ability to work in a team, and a very high level of commitment High level of accountability, capability to deal with uncertainty and execute in an ambiguous environment Very good command of English and a willingness to travel. As the world's leading reinsurance company with more than 11,000 employees at over 50 locations, Munich Re introduces a paradigm shift in the way you think about insurance. By turning uncertainty into a manageable risk we enable fundamental change. Join us working on topics today that will concern society tomorrow, whether that be climate change, major construction projects, medical risk assessment or even space travel. Together we embrace a culture where multiskilled teams dare to think big. We create the new and the different for our clients and cultivate innovation. Sounds like you? Make it happen and be part of Munich Re. You will work in an environment where we think big: Change and culture are continuously role-modeled. We create and articulate a compelling and ambitious shared purpose, vision and direction. We pave the way towards success and see failure as learning You are going to experience that we care & dare: We are empathetic. We know when to lead and know when to let others lead. We attract, grow and coach future leaders We communicate in a clear & authentic way: We interact with a positive and humble spirit. We solicit feedback, ask and listen, learn and unlearn You will grow with your clients: Whatever our role, we support business, in an efficient and effective way, to create value for our clients. We embrace new ways of working leveraging digitalization to deliver solutions Join us, and experience that we lead the We: We have a passion for winning and growing as a team. We inspire people to be capable of joint performance. We create an inclusive environment where different thoughts, generations, cultures and experiences are valued and encouraged Apply now! Severely disabled candidates will also be prioritised, if equally qualified.

Company Name:
Monasterium Laboratory Skin & Hair Research Solutions GmbH
1.1
Job Description:
About Monasterium:
Monasterium Laboratory is a dermatological research company specialized in preclinical skin, hair, pigmentation, neuroendocrinology, immunology, and wound healing research in the human system. Given the continuous expansion of our company, we are seeking a team-orientated, highly motivated and enthusiastic Junior Staff Scientist (m/f/d) full time to join our team. For any details regarding the company, range of research topics covered, assays in use, and international academic research network, please visit the website https://www.monasteriumlab.com/

Your tasks:

The main responsibility will be to assist the Project Lead in the organization and execution of internal and contract research projects under the direction of a Team Leader. The main task is to manage assigned projects under the supervision of a staff scientist and a Team Leader by designing experiments, executing laboratory work, preparing progress and milestones reports, and presenting research results in internal meetings. Full scientific, technical, and project management .

PURPOSE OF YOUR JOB
Scientist (w/m/d) Drug Product Characterization for Biopharmaceuticals – Liquid Chromatography
Our “Business Unit Formulation and Lyophilization” is looking for a new colleague, who wants to be a part & contribute in our new Liquid Chromatography team in Martinsried close to Munich.
Are you passionate about Formulation and HPLC to drive the growth of Coriolis at Martinsried?

Come be part of our growing and highly motivated team – apply now!
YOUR RESPONSIBILITY
Lead/support client projects for the characterization biopharmaceutical molecules in drug products by using liquid chromatography (LC) techniques (e.g., HPLC and UPLC systems of various manufacturers; SEC, IEX, RP and other separation principles)

Company Name: Leibniz Institut DSMZ - Deutsche Sammlung von Mikroorganismen und Zellkulturen GmbH
Job Description:
Job offer 30/22
To build a global biodata resource center
the Leibniz Institute DSMZ-German Collection of Microorganisms and Cell Cultures GmbH establishes an integrated suite of scientific databases of fundamental relevance for the life sciences. The databases include BRENDA, SILVA, LPSN, BacDive and TYGS which are developed in a highly coordinated manner. A dedicated team of 22 scientists and software engineers builds a common research data infrastructure to significantly improve the access to a plethora of curated and standardized biological data. The resulting data platform DSMZ Digital Diversity will provide an integrated resource and will allow to link and comprehensively analyze the different types of scientific data from all domains of life sciences. For more information visit stb.dsmz.de.
Senior scientist (m/f/d)

„Alle 11 Minuten verliebt sich ein:e Kolleg:in in unsere Analyse.”

Wir analysieren das große Ganze, haben keine Angst vor Statistik und Machine Learning und geben wertvolle Handlungsempfehlungen an alle Abteilungen. Senior Data Scientist (m/w/d)

Bei Vodafone arbeiten wir jeden Tag an einer besseren Zukunft. Für eine Welt, die besser vernetzt, inklusiver und nachhaltiger ist. Denn für uns ist Technologie nur so stark wie die Menschen, die sie nutzen. Sei dabei und lass uns gemeinsam die Welt von morgen gestalten.

Was Dich erwartet:
Du verantwortest als Senior Data Scientist die Entwicklung von Anwendungen von Big Data, Machine Learning oder KI

Unser Experten-Team aus Spezialist:innen für Advanced Analytics, Machine Learning, Data Science und Data Engineering unterstützt unsere Entwicklungsteams bei innovativen Lösungen für unserer Kund:innen.
Das sind Ihre Aufgaben:
Analyse von Datensätze um Zusammenhänge zu erkennen und zu interpretieren sowie die Qualität der Daten zu bewerten
Integration von statistischen- und ML-Modellen in unsere Produkte, unter Beachtung von Skalierungsaspekten.
Zusammenarbeit mit anderen talentierten Data Scientists, Data Engineers und Software Developer sowie diversen Stakeholdern in einem agilen Arbeitsumfeld
Verfolgen von neusten Entwicklungen in Data Science und Testen neuer Modellierungsansätzen auf ihre Praxistauglichkeit bzw. Einsatzmöglichkeiten
Teilen von Ergebnisse und Wissen mit Stakeholdern und Kolleg:innen

We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist (all genders) to join our D&A department at flaconi. You are part of our Data Science Team with up to 10 people. In this role, you run your own Data Science projects in ML, Forecasting & Product Recommenders and explore further development of Data Science products.
What can you expect? The chance to significantly shape Data Science solutions and work on projects with strategic impact on company results as well as a progressive, modern data stack at hand.
You will work independently and have the chance to get first leadership experiences by leading and supporting our Junior members.

Your role
In your role, you are part of the Data Science team to run dedicated Data Science projects with E2E ownership
Your tasks are covering Data Models and automated decisions solutions mainly in Machine Learning, Forecasting and Product Recommenders

Overview
We are currently seeking a Scientist Immunomonitoring* to support our team in the development of innovative immunotherapeutic products. You will work in Tübingen (Germany) in an interdisciplinary environment with colleagues from all research as well as business development and intellectual property departments. Your analytical reasoning and action-oriented style as well as your organization and communication skills will contribute to the team’s success.
Your mission
Your main responsibilities will include but are not limited to the following tasks:
Planning, supervision, documentation and reporting of clinical Immunomonitoring data using a wide range of standardized cellular and immunological techniques

Über uns
Wir bei Conrad wollen als zuverlässiger Partner für unsere Kund*innen die Beschaffung von technischem Bedarf so einfach und effizient wie möglich machen. Dafür arbeiten wir täglich mit Leidenschaft und Einfallsreichtum, um dank smarter Lösungen Europas führende Beschaffungsplattform zu werden. Wir bieten ein hochwertiges Sortiment mit Millionen von technischen Produkten und kundenzentrierte Services mit echtem Mehrwert. Wir denken mit, handeln vorausschauend und inspirieren unsere Kund*innen mit unserer Expertise in Technologie. Als Familienunternehmen legen wir größten Wert auf nachhaltiges Wirtschaften und langfristige Beziehungen. Wir stehen für Qualität und Zuverlässigkeit.

Aufgabe + Herausforderungen
Festlegung von Datenanalysezielen, gemeinsam mit anderen Fachabteilungen
Sammeln und Auswahl von strukturierten und unstrukturierten Daten aus internen sowie externen Quellen
Datenorganisation und Datenmodellierung mit Methoden der Statistik und der Künstlichen Intelligenz
Datenanalyse, Interpretation von Datenmustern - Erkennen von Zusammenhängen und Trends
Erstellung von Reports und Darstellung der Analyseergebnisse
Weiterentwicklung des Fachgebiets
Planung und Unterstützung des Aufbaus der erforderlichen technischen Infrastruktur

AITAD ist ein junges, wachsendes Unternehmen aus Süddeutschland, welches durch einen gesamtheitlichen Automatisierungsansatz Embedded-KI-Systembestandteile für die mittelständische Industrie und Konsumentengerätehersteller entwickelt. Durch die einzigartige Ausstattung, das Kompetenzgebiet sowie die ambitionierten, marktprägenden und sichtbaren Kundenprojekte stellt AITAD eine einzigartige Basis für eigene Ideenrealisierungen, Kompetenzaufbau und Spezialisierungsentfaltungen dar. Deshalb suchen wir laufend neugierige, kreative und ambitionierte Menschen mit unterschiedlichen Fähigkeiten und Hintergründen.

Aufgaben

Analyse, Aufbereitung und Machine-Learning-Modellierung von bestimmten Prozessen/gemessenen Daten.
Entwickeln und Durchführen von Konzepten zum Datensammeln.
Qualifikation

Benefits

Deutsche Post DHL Group ist der weltweit führende Post- und Logistikdienstleister. Als einer der größten Arbeitgeber der Welt in über 220 Ländern und Territorien sehen wir die Welt mit anderen Augen. Mit unserem auf Service, Qualität und Nachhaltigkeit ausgerichteten Netzwerk verbinden wir Menschen auf der ganzen Welt und verbessern deren Lebensqualität. Das gilt nicht nur für unsere Kunden, sondern auch für jedes einzelne Mitglied unseres Teams.
Die Abteilung Hauptlauf Betrieb ist zentral verantwortlich für die Logistik zwischen 82 Brief- und 34 Paketsortierzentren in Deutschland. Das starke Wachstum im KEP- Markt, die fortschreitende Digitalisierung unserer Prozesse und die steigenden Anforderungen an nachhaltige Transporte unter Umweltgesichtspunkten erfordern eine stetige Weiterentwicklung der Logistikstrukturen und IT-Systeme.
Als Referent in der zentralen Gruppe Transport begleiten Sie Neu- und Weiterentwicklungsprojekte von der Konzeptionierung bis zum Rollout, stellen die dafür erforderlichen Datengrundlagen bereit und entwickeln als zentraler Ansprechpartner die Reporting- und Controllingmodelle und -strukturen.

Wir bewegen die Zukunft!
Die Technik der Zukunft liegt bei uns! Spezialisiert in Software-Entwicklung, Test, Validierung sowie Consulting- und Assessment Services sind wir als Technologiepartner namhafter Unternehmen immer am Puls der Zeit. Begeisterst Du Dich für Technik und Software? Dann findest Du bei uns in den Branchen Automotive, Rail und Industry herausfordernde und vielseitige Projekte.
Seit 2020 sind wir eine Tochter der DB Engineering & Consulting, die mit ihren Mitarbeitenden für zahlreiche Projekte der Deutschen Bahn und in internationalen Schienenprojekten aktiv ist. Damit gehören wir zu einem der größten Ingenieurbüros Deutschlands.
Als Data Scientist (m/w/d) erwarten Dich Aufgaben aus den Bereichen Computer Vision, Predictive Maintenance und der Erkennung von Anomalien. Du erschließt Datenquellen, erstellst Annotationsanleitungen und modifizierst Datensätze in unterschiedlichen Projekten. Zudem arbeitest Du mit unseren Kunden produktiv einsetzbare Lösungen aus.

Job Title: R&D Scientist in Automated Trading and Energy Market Analytics
Job Description:
At Hitachi Energy our purpose is advancing a sustainable energy future for all. We bring power to our homes, schools, hospitals and factories. Join us and work with fantastic people, while learning and developing yourself on projects that have a real impact to our communities and society. Bring your passion, bring your energy, and be part of a global team that appreciates a simple truth: Diversity + Collaboration = Great Innovation
Hitachi Energy Research are looking for a Researcher with expertise in the area of Automated Trading and Energy Market Analytics. You will join a dynamic, motivated and creative team with a broad range of experience and competences. As part of our team you will combine theory with practice, creating, testing and validating new technologies to enable the energy transition. For this position you can be located at one of our research centers in Mannheim/Germany, Baden/Switzerland, Montreal/Canada, Raleigh/US, Krakow/Poland or Västeras/Sweden.
Your responsibilities

A Moving Experience.
We are looking for a motivated research application scientist to join us design, develop and maintain the next generation natural language understanding (NLU) system for the automotive and mobility markets.
In this role you will work with state of the art machine learning techniques to deliver an in-car AI experience.
You will work on data annotation, statistical model development, accuracy improvement and defect resolution.

Development of the NLU pipeline
Development of new use cases and features in NLU
Define and refine annotation specifications
Develop and maintain dictionaries, grammar rules and annotations.

Senior Data Scientist (f/m/d)
About the Role

Essity has a clear strategy to become a data driven organization and is investing in collecting and analyzing data from sales, back office and the factory floor to provide to enable more relevant insights across the organization. Essity has already deployed connected solutions using IoT technologies in Professional Hygiene and Incontinence Care solutions to improve the lives of people using these new technologies. To take this to the next level we need new capabilities to unlock the insights hidden within these data sources.

Therefore, we are searching for an experienced Senior Data Scientist (f/m/d). The purpose of the role is to develop data-driven solutions to difficult business challenges across a range of business domains by using state-of-the-art machine learning techniques and understand how to convert theory and models into company operations. The Senior Data Scientist will as act as a team leader for the data science team (line management responsibility).

At DB Schenker, you are part of a global logistics network that connects the world. A network that allows you to shape your career by encouraging you to contribute and truly make a difference. With more than 76,000 colleagues worldwide, we welcome diversity and thrive on individual backgrounds, perspectives and skills. Together as one team, we are Here to move.

Are you a tinkerer by trade? Do you enjoy questioning the status quo? Do complex and difficult challenges excite you? If yes, this may be the team for you. As a Data Scientist in Workforce Staffing, your work is focused on research programs to deeply understand the people that make up our hourly workforce. You understand that even when hiring hundreds of thousands of hourly associates across multiple types of roles and businesses, the experience of each candidate matters. You use your deep expertise in statistics (regressions, multilevel models, structural equation models, etc.), and data collection in a variety of settings (e.g., field studies, surveys, existing large data sets) to define and answer nebulous problems. You leverage your quantitative background to develop and test theoretical frameworks and design experiments. You design, deployment, and conduct analysis of our global candidate research activities, using experimental, quasi-experimental, and RCT methods. You relentlessly obsess over understanding our candidates and what attracts them to Amazon. You work with colleagues across Research, Data Science, Business Intelligence and related teams to enable Amazon find and hire the right candidates for the right roles at an unprecedented scale. This will be a highly visible role across multiple key deliverables for our global organization. If you are passionate and curious about data, obsess over customers, love questioning the status quo, and want to make the world a better place, let’s chat.

About ICIS
ICIS is part of Risk Solutions Group (RSG) a division of RELX Group, a FTSE 20 company with revenues of $9.5 billion in 2020. ICIS make some of the world’s most important markets more trusted and predictable by providing data services, thought leadership and decision tools. We exist to help businesses in the energy, petrochemical and fertilizer industries make strategic decisions, mitigate risk, improve productivity, and capitalise on new opportunities. Thousands of decisions are taken across supply chains every day using our intelligence and we make this possible through a global presence that delivers the targeted, local insights customers need to achieve growth in this new world of meaningful data. Shaping the world by connecting markets to optimise the worlds valuable resources. With a global team of more than 700, ICIS has employees based in London, New York, Houston, Karlsruhe, Milan, Mumbai, Singapore, Guangzhou, Beijing, Shanghai, Dubai, Sao Paulo, Seoul, Tokyo and Perth.
Job Purpose
You will drive data-based innovation by developing analytical models, visualisations, and tools to analyse and forecast one of the largest industries in the world - the chemical industry - a complex global supply network. As a Data Scientist, you will join our experienced team of Data Scientists and work closely together with our large team of market analysts around the globe. Our models cover prices, supply / demand, costs and logistics to drive trading and production decisions across the industry. You will be part of an international team, which requires occasional travel globally. As of day one, you will have responsibility in demanding analytics innovation projects - your first focus will be to support the development of our analytics platform, providing analysts and clients with market analytics and visualisations tools to better understand and forecast the complex chemical value chain, from oil to refined products. Our Senior Data Scientists will help you grow into taking ownership of analytics around parts of the markets for which you will be able to drive innovation.

About ICIS
ICIS is part of Risk Solutions Group (RSG) a division of RELX Group, a FTSE 20 company with revenues of $9.5 billion in 2020. ICIS make some of the world’s most important markets more trusted and predictable by providing data services, thought leadership and decision tools. We exist to help businesses in the energy, petrochemical and fertilizer industries make strategic decisions, mitigate risk, improve productivity, and capitalise on new opportunities. Thousands of decisions are taken across supply chains every day using our intelligence and we make this possible through a global presence that delivers the targeted, local insights customers need to achieve growth in this new world of meaningful data. Shaping the world by connecting markets to optimise the worlds valuable resources. With a global team of more than 700, ICIS has employees based in London, New York, Houston, Karlsruhe, Milan, Mumbai, Singapore, Guangzhou, Beijing, Shanghai, Dubai, Sao Paulo, Seoul, Tokyo and Perth.
Job Purpose
You will drive data-based innovation by developing analytical models, visualisations, and tools to analyse and forecast one of the largest industries in the world - the chemical industry - a complex global supply network. As a Data Scientist, you will join our experienced team of Data Scientists and work closely together with our large team of market analysts around the globe. Our models cover prices, supply / demand, costs and logistics to drive trading and production decisions across the industry. You will be part of an international team, which requires occasional travel globally. As of day one, you will have responsibility in demanding analytics innovation projects - your first focus will be to support the development of our analytics platform, providing analysts and clients with market analytics and visualisations tools to better understand and forecast the complex chemical value chain, from oil to refined products. Our Senior Data Scientists will help you grow into taking ownership of analytics around parts of the markets for which you will be able to drive innovation.

Job summary *Flexibility for alternate EU Amazon offices* Amazon’s mission is to be the most customer centric company in the world. The Workforce Staffing organization is on the front line of that mission by hiring the hourly fulfilment associates who make that mission a reality. To drive the necessary growth and continued scale of Amazon’s associate needs within a constrained employment environment, Amazon is creating a Workforce Staffing Analytics program. This program will re-invent how Amazon attracts, communicates with, and ultimately hires its hourly associates. This team will own multi-layered research and program implementation to drive deep learnings, process improvements, and strategic recommendations to global leadership. Are you passionate about data? Are you a tinkerer by trade? Do you enjoy questioning the status quo? Do complex and difficult challenges excite you? If yes, this may be the team for you. As a Data Scientist in Workforce Staffing, your work is focused on research programs to deeply understand the people that make up our hourly workforce. You understand that even when hiring hundreds of thousands of hourly associates across multiple types of roles and businesses, the experience of each candidate matters. You use your deep expertise in statistics (regressions, multilevel models, structural equation models, etc.), and data collection in a variety of settings (e.g., field studies, surveys, existing large data sets) to define and answer nebulous problems. You leverage your quantitative background to develop and test theoretical frameworks and design experiments. You design, deployment, and conduct analysis of our global candidate research activities, using experimental, quasi-experimental, and RCT methods. You relentlessly obsess over understanding our candidates and what attracts them to Amazon. You work with colleagues across Research, Data Science, Business Intelligence and related teams to enable Amazon find and hire the right candidates for the right roles at an unprecedented scale. This will be a highly visible role across multiple key deliverables for our global organization. If you are passionate and curious about data, obsess over customers, love questioning the status quo, and want to make the world a better place, let’s chat.

About ICIS
ICIS is part of Risk Solutions Group (RSG) a division of RELX Group, a FTSE 20 company with revenues of $9.5 billion in 2020. ICIS make some of the world’s most important markets more trusted and predictable by providing data services, thought leadership and decision tools. We exist to help businesses in the energy, petrochemical and fertilizer industries make strategic decisions, mitigate risk, improve productivity, and capitalise on new opportunities. Thousands of decisions are taken across supply chains every day using our intelligence and we make this possible through a global presence that delivers the targeted, local insights customers need to achieve growth in this new world of meaningful data. Shaping the world by connecting markets to optimise the worlds valuable resources. With a global team of more than 700, ICIS has employees based in London, New York, Houston, Karlsruhe, Milan, Mumbai, Singapore, Guangzhou, Beijing, Shanghai, Dubai, Sao Paulo, Seoul, Tokyo and Perth.
Job Purpose
You will drive data-based innovation by developing analytical models, visualisations, and tools to analyse and forecast one of the largest industries in the world - the chemical industry - a complex global supply network. As a Data Scientist, you will join our experienced team of Data Scientists and work closely together with our large team of market analysts around the globe. Our models cover prices, supply / demand, costs and logistics to drive trading and production decisions across the industry. You will be part of an international team, which requires occasional travel globally. As of day one, you will have responsibility in demanding analytics innovation projects - your first focus will be to support the development of our analytics platform, providing analysts and clients with market analytics and visualisations tools to better understand and forecast the complex chemical value chain, from oil to refined products. Our Senior Data Scientists will help you grow into taking ownership of analytics around parts of the markets for which you will be able to drive innovation.

Job summary *Flexibility for alternate EU Amazon offices* Amazon’s mission is to be the most customer centric company in the world. The Workforce Staffing organization is on the front line of that mission by hiring the hourly fulfilment associates who make that mission a reality. To drive the necessary growth and continued scale of Amazon’s associate needs within a constrained employment environment, Amazon is creating a Workforce Staffing Analytics program. This program will re-invent how Amazon attracts, communicates with, and ultimately hires its hourly associates. This team will own multi-layered research and program implementation to drive deep learnings, process improvements, and strategic recommendations to global leadership. Are you passionate about data? Are you a tinkerer by trade? Do you enjoy questioning the status quo? Do complex and difficult challenges excite you? If yes, this may be the team for you. As a Data Scientist in Workforce Staffing, your work is focused on research programs to deeply understand the people that make up our hourly workforce. You understand that even when hiring hundreds of thousands of hourly associates across multiple types of roles and businesses, the experience of each candidate matters. You use your deep expertise in statistics (regressions, multilevel models, structural equation models, etc.), and data collection in a variety of settings (e.g., field studies, surveys, existing large data sets) to define and answer nebulous problems. You leverage your quantitative background to develop and test theoretical frameworks and design experiments. You design, deployment, and conduct analysis of our global candidate research activities, using experimental, quasi-experimental, and RCT methods. You relentlessly obsess over understanding our candidates and what attracts them to Amazon. You work with colleagues across Research, Data Science, Business Intelligence and related teams to enable Amazon find and hire the right candidates for the right roles at an unprecedented scale. This will be a highly visible role across multiple key deliverables for our global organization. If you are passionate and curious about data, obsess over customers, love questioning the status quo, and want to make the world a better place, let’s chat.

About ICIS
ICIS is part of Risk Solutions Group (RSG) a division of RELX Group, a FTSE 20 company with revenues of $9.5 billion in 2020. ICIS make some of the world’s most important markets more trusted and predictable by providing data services, thought leadership and decision tools. We exist to help businesses in the energy, petrochemical and fertilizer industries make strategic decisions, mitigate risk, improve productivity, and capitalise on new opportunities. Thousands of decisions are taken across supply chains every day using our intelligence and we make this possible through a global presence that delivers the targeted, local insights customers need to achieve growth in this new world of meaningful data. Shaping the world by connecting markets to optimise the worlds valuable resources. With a global team of more than 700, ICIS has employees based in London, New York, Houston, Karlsruhe, Milan, Mumbai, Singapore, Guangzhou, Beijing, Shanghai, Dubai, Sao Paulo, Seoul, Tokyo and Perth.
Job Purpose
You will drive data-based innovation by developing analytical models, visualisations, and tools to analyse and forecast one of the largest industries in the world - the chemical industry - a complex global supply network. As a Data Scientist, you will join our experienced team of Data Scientists and work closely together with our large team of market analysts around the globe. Our models cover prices, supply / demand, costs and logistics to drive trading and production decisions across the industry. You will be part of an international team, which requires occasional travel globally. As of day one, you will have responsibility in demanding analytics innovation projects - your first focus will be to support the development of our analytics platform, providing analysts and clients with market analytics and visualisations tools to better understand and forecast the complex chemical value chain, from oil to refined products. Our Senior Data Scientists will help you grow into taking ownership of analytics around parts of the markets for which you will be able to drive innovation.

Job summary *Flexibility for alternate EU Amazon offices* Amazon’s mission is to be the most customer centric company in the world. The Workforce Staffing organization is on the front line of that mission by hiring the hourly fulfilment associates who make that mission a reality. To drive the necessary growth and continued scale of Amazon’s associate needs within a constrained employment environment, Amazon is creating a Workforce Staffing Analytics program. This program will re-invent how Amazon attracts, communicates with, and ultimately hires its hourly associates. This team will own multi-layered research and program implementation to drive deep learnings, process improvements, and strategic recommendations to global leadership. Are you passionate about data? Are you a tinkerer by trade? Do you enjoy questioning the status quo? Do complex and difficult challenges excite you? If yes, this may be the team for you. As a Data Scientist in Workforce Staffing, your work is focused on research programs to deeply understand the people that make up our hourly workforce. You understand that even when hiring hundreds of thousands of hourly associates across multiple types of roles and businesses, the experience of each candidate matters. You use your deep expertise in statistics (regressions, multilevel models, structural equation models, etc.), and data collection in a variety of settings (e.g., field studies, surveys, existing large data sets) to define and answer nebulous problems. You leverage your quantitative background to develop and test theoretical frameworks and design experiments. You design, deployment, and conduct analysis of our global candidate research activities, using experimental, quasi-experimental, and RCT methods. You relentlessly obsess over understanding our candidates and what attracts them to Amazon. You work with colleagues across Research, Data Science, Business Intelligence and related teams to enable Amazon find and hire the right candidates for the right roles at an unprecedented scale. This will be a highly visible role across multiple key deliverables for our global organization. If you are passionate and curious about data, obsess over customers, love questioning the status quo, and want to make the world a better place, let’s chat.

About ICIS
ICIS is part of Risk Solutions Group (RSG) a division of RELX Group, a FTSE 20 company with revenues of $9.5 billion in 2020. ICIS make some of the world’s most important markets more trusted and predictable by providing data services, thought leadership and decision tools. We exist to help businesses in the energy, petrochemical and fertilizer industries make strategic decisions, mitigate risk, improve productivity, and capitalise on new opportunities. Thousands of decisions are taken across supply chains every day using our intelligence and we make this possible through a global presence that delivers the targeted, local insights customers need to achieve growth in this new world of meaningful data. Shaping the world by connecting markets to optimise the worlds valuable resources. With a global team of more than 700, ICIS has employees based in London, New York, Houston, Karlsruhe, Milan, Mumbai, Singapore, Guangzhou, Beijing, Shanghai, Dubai, Sao Paulo, Seoul, Tokyo and Perth.
Job Purpose
You will drive data-based innovation by developing analytical models, visualisations, and tools to analyse and forecast one of the largest industries in the world - the chemical industry - a complex global supply network. As a Data Scientist, you will join our experienced team of Data Scientists and work closely together with our large team of market analysts around the globe. Our models cover prices, supply / demand, costs and logistics to drive trading and production decisions across the industry. You will be part of an international team, which requires occasional travel globally. As of day one, you will have responsibility in demanding analytics innovation projects - your first focus will be to support the development of our analytics platform, providing analysts and clients with market analytics and visualisations tools to better understand and forecast the complex chemical value chain, from oil to refined products. Our Senior Data Scientists will help you grow into taking ownership of analytics around parts of the markets for which you will be able to drive innovation.

Job summary *Flexibility for alternate EU Amazon offices* Amazon’s mission is to be the most customer centric company in the world. The Workforce Staffing organization is on the front line of that mission by hiring the hourly fulfilment associates who make that mission a reality. To drive the necessary growth and continued scale of Amazon’s associate needs within a constrained employment environment, Amazon is creating a Workforce Staffing Analytics program. This program will re-invent how Amazon attracts, communicates with, and ultimately hires its hourly associates. This team will own multi-layered research and program implementation to drive deep learnings, process improvements, and strategic recommendations to global leadership. Are you passionate about data? Are you a tinkerer by trade? Do you enjoy questioning the status quo? Do complex and difficult challenges excite you? If yes, this may be the team for you. As a Data Scientist in Workforce Staffing, your work is focused on research programs to deeply understand the people that make up our hourly workforce. You understand that even when hiring hundreds of thousands of hourly associates across multiple types of roles and businesses, the experience of each candidate matters. You use your deep expertise in statistics (regressions, multilevel models, structural equation models, etc.), and data collection in a variety of settings (e.g., field studies, surveys, existing large data sets) to define and answer nebulous problems. You leverage your quantitative background to develop and test theoretical frameworks and design experiments. You design, deployment, and conduct analysis of our global candidate research activities, using experimental, quasi-experimental, and RCT methods. You relentlessly obsess over understanding our candidates and what attracts them to Amazon. You work with colleagues across Research, Data Science, Business Intelligence and related teams to enable Amazon find and hire the right candidates for the right roles at an unprecedented scale. This will be a highly visible role across multiple key deliverables for our global organization. If you are passionate and curious about data, obsess over customers, love questioning the status quo, and want to make the world a better place, let’s chat.

Im Squad "Lead Automation & Orchestration Postbank“ suchen wir eine/-n Data Scientist, der/die uns in der Bewertung und Messung von Kunden-Ansprachen unterstützt. Der Fokus liegt auf der Erstellung und Weiterentwicklung von automatisierten Reports und der Analyse durchgeführter Kampagnen. Das Ergebnis zeigt wirkungsvoll Verbesserungsmöglichkeiten auf und trägt dazu bei, effizienter zu werden.

About ICIS
ICIS is part of Risk Solutions Group (RSG) a division of RELX Group, a FTSE 20 company with revenues of $9.5 billion in 2020. ICIS make some of the world’s most important markets more trusted and predictable by providing data services, thought leadership and decision tools. We exist to help businesses in the energy, petrochemical and fertilizer industries make strategic decisions, mitigate risk, improve productivity, and capitalise on new opportunities. Thousands of decisions are taken across supply chains every day using our intelligence and we make this possible through a global presence that delivers the targeted, local insights customers need to achieve growth in this new world of meaningful data. Shaping the world by connecting markets to optimise the worlds valuable resources. With a global team of more than 700, ICIS has employees based in London, New York, Houston, Karlsruhe, Milan, Mumbai, Singapore, Guangzhou, Beijing, Shanghai, Dubai, Sao Paulo, Seoul, Tokyo and Perth.
Job Purpose
You will drive data-based innovation by developing analytical models, visualisations, and tools to analyse and forecast one of the largest industries in the world - the chemical industry - a complex global supply network. As a Data Scientist, you will join our experienced team of Data Scientists and work closely together with our large team of market analysts around the globe. Our models cover prices, supply / demand, costs and logistics to drive trading and production decisions across the industry. You will be part of an international team, which requires occasional travel globally. As of day one, you will have responsibility in demanding analytics innovation projects - your first focus will be to support the development of our analytics platform, providing analysts and clients with market analytics and visualisations tools to better understand and forecast the complex chemical value chain, from oil to refined products. Our Senior Data Scientists will help you grow into taking ownership of analytics around parts of the markets for which you will be able to drive innovation.

Job summary *Flexibility for alternate EU Amazon offices* Amazon’s mission is to be the most customer centric company in the world. The Workforce Staffing organization is on the front line of that mission by hiring the hourly fulfilment associates who make that mission a reality. To drive the necessary growth and continued scale of Amazon’s associate needs within a constrained employment environment, Amazon is creating a Workforce Staffing Analytics program. This program will re-invent how Amazon attracts, communicates with, and ultimately hires its hourly associates. This team will own multi-layered research and program implementation to drive deep learnings, process improvements, and strategic recommendations to global leadership. Are you passionate about data? Are you a tinkerer by trade? Do you enjoy questioning the status quo? Do complex and difficult challenges excite you? If yes, this may be the team for you. As a Data Scientist in Workforce Staffing, your work is focused on research programs to deeply understand the people that make up our hourly workforce. You understand that even when hiring hundreds of thousands of hourly associates across multiple types of roles and businesses, the experience of each candidate matters. You use your deep expertise in statistics (regressions, multilevel models, structural equation models, etc.), and data collection in a variety of settings (e.g., field studies, surveys, existing large data sets) to define and answer nebulous problems. You leverage your quantitative background to develop and test theoretical frameworks and design experiments. You design, deployment, and conduct analysis of our global candidate research activities, using experimental, quasi-experimental, and RCT methods. You relentlessly obsess over understanding our candidates and what attracts them to Amazon. You work with colleagues across Research, Data Science, Business Intelligence and related teams to enable Amazon find and hire the right candidates for the right roles at an unprecedented scale. This will be a highly visible role across multiple key deliverables for our global organization. If you are passionate and curious about data, obsess over customers, love questioning the status quo, and want to make the world a better place, let’s chat.

At Yelp, it’s our mission to connect people with great local businesses. Our centralized team is the most wide-ranging consumer of data at Yelp, adept at tasks from modeling content growth and user behavior to sharing insights about the health of local economies. Job summary *Flexibility for alternate EU Amazon offices* Amazon’s mission is to be the most customer centric company in the world. The Workforce Staffing organization is on the front line of that mission by hiring the hourly fulfilment associates who make that mission a reality. To drive the necessary growth and continued scale of Amazon’s associate needs within a constrained employment environment, Amazon is creating a Workforce Staffing Analytics program. This program will re-invent how Amazon attracts, communicates with, and ultimately hires its hourly associates. This team will own multi-layered research and program implementation to drive deep learnings, process improvements, and strategic recommendations to global leadership. Are you passionate about data? Are you a tinkerer by trade? Do you enjoy questioning the status quo? Do complex and difficult challenges excite you? If yes, this may be the team for you. As a Data Scientist in Workforce Staffing, your work is focused on research programs to deeply understand the people that make up our hourly workforce. You understand that even when hiring hundreds of thousands of hourly associates across multiple types of roles and businesses, the experience of each candidate matters. You use your deep expertise in statistics (regressions, multilevel models, structural equation models, etc.), and data collection in a variety of settings (e.g., field studies, surveys, existing large data sets) to define and answer nebulous problems. You leverage your quantitative background to develop and test theoretical frameworks and design experiments. You design, deployment, and conduct analysis of our global candidate research activities, using experimental, quasi-experimental, and RCT methods. You relentlessly obsess over understanding our candidates and what attracts them to Amazon. You work with colleagues across Research, Data Science, Business Intelligence and related teams to enable Amazon find and hire the right candidates for the right roles at an unprecedented scale. This will be a highly visible role across multiple key deliverables for our global organization. If you are passionate and curious about data, obsess over customers, love questioning the status quo, and want to make the world a better place, let’s chat.

At Yelp, it’s our mission to connect people with great local businesses.
